page.title: 09FARMS AND FARMING
page.content: In our block the farms are mostly dairy farms. The main breeds of cattle are Friesians and Herefords. There are 20 farms ranging in size from 30 to 500 acres. Nearly all of the land is used for grazing or growing hay and silage. The farms have between 30 and 200 cows which are milked in modern parlours by machine. Milk is collected daily and taken by lorries to Alfreton creamery. 1985 has been a good year because there was a lot of rain in the spring. The crops have grown very tall and the silage pits and hay barns are very full. A few farmers grow barley and potatoes. A number of the farms are mixed and have sheep as well as cattle. Most of them have up to 300 sheep and lambs. The farmers sell lambs for meat at Bakewell market. Wool is sold from the ewes and rams. Christopher Beever (11)
